did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Publius Virgilius Rogers papers, 1843-1918.
did.physdesc: Correspondence, accounts, mortgages, notes, articles, papers.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Correspondence, accounts, mortgages, notes, articles, and other papers largely relating to Rogers' interests in banking affairs, the industrial development of central New York, and land and railroad investments; also, letters and papers concerning his son and family.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Lawyer and bank president in Utica, New York.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, accounts, mortgages, notes, articles, and other papers largely relating to Rogers' interests in banking affairs, the industrial development of central New York, and land and railroad investments. Includes letters and papers of Rogers' son, Charles Butler Rogers, and material relating to the Central Railroad of Iowa, the Flint & Pere Marquette Railroad, Hamilton College, the Iowa Valley Construction Company, the Oswego River Starch Company, the Patent Cereals Company of Geneva, New York, the Remington Armory at Ilion, New York, the Utica Steam Cotton Mills, and the Utica Steam Woolen Mills. Other topics include merchandizing, dairy farming, travel description, gold mining in Colorado, student life in Germany at the Koniglichen Friedrich-Willelms Universitat, hospitals, charitable institutions, and art; Correspondents include Isaac M. Cate, William W. Crapo, William H. Ferry, George S. Goodale, H. C. Potter, JohnH. Prentiss, F. W. H. Sheffield, Breese Stevens, and Anson J. Upson.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Publius Virgilius Rogers papers, #821. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

Series III. Correspondence
November 1843-December 1869 (529 Pieces)
1870 (446 Pieces)

scopecontent.p: Correspondence is mainly concerned with stock and bond purchases in railroads. The Central railroad Company of Iowa and Flint and Pere Marquette Railway, Saginaw, Michigan. (H.C. Potter, Secretary-Treasurer)

did.unittitle: 1871 (426 Pieces)
1875 (455 Pieces)
1876 (521 Pieces)
June 7, 1882-December 26, 1886 (400-500 Pieces)

scopecontent.p: Letters are from banks and investment houses primarily, with a few letters from railroads. More personal correspondence and household purchases
Letters from son, Charles B. Rogers at Hamilton College. Investment news, mainly from Piers Brothers (The Patent Cereals Co.), N.Y., N.Y.

did.unittitle: Purchase receipts, January 1, 1904-April 1906
Series of eighty letters from son Charles Rogers from various cities in Europe; Approx. 200 undated pieces
Letters to Charles B. Rogers mainly concerning his dairy operations near Utica
Various Letters
Series IV. Miscellaneous
Loose Items
Typed and printed chapters to a book, broadsides, genealogy, contracts, bonds, misc. manuscript material
Newspaper clippings
